intro: Papaver rhoeas var. albomarginatum, commonly known as the white-margin poppy, is a variant of the common poppy characterized by its distinctive white margins on the petals. This cultivar is prized for its ornamental value, featuring bright red or orange petals with a striking white border. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and thrives in well-drained soil in full sun. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds, which can be sown in the autumn for spring germination. Its botanical features make it a popular choice for gardens and floral arrangements.
